docs.snippet: While some heads of state use prime television time to find excuses for their actions, MilianMiljanic, the Yugoslav coach, today took time off to appear on television and publicly apologize to his fellow countrymen for his actions against West...
docs.lead_paragraph: While some heads of state use prime television time to find excuses for their actions, MilianMiljanic, the Yugoslav coach, today took time off to appear on television and publicly apologize to his fellow countrymen for his actions against West Germany on Wednesday night.

headline.main: Coach of Yugoslav Team Apologizes for Its Loss; High Tides Around New York

docs.snippet: Vice President Maria Estela Martinez de Peron became Acting President of Argentina today while her husband, Juan Domingo Peron, lay seriously ill with what his personal physicians described as infectious bronchitis with heart complications.

headline.main: WIFE WILL GOVERN WHILE PERON IS ILLL; Remains President

docs.snippet: President Nixon and Leonid I. Brezhnev signed a 10-year economic agreement in Moscow and then flew to Yalta in the Crimea to continue their talks on arms control. In a session with the Soviet leaders in the Kremlin, Mr. Nixon was understood to have...
docs.lead_paragraph: President Nixon and Leonid I. Brezhnev signed a 10-year economic agreement in Moscow and then flew to Yalta in the Crimea to continue their talks on arms control. In a session with the Soviet leaders in the Kremlin, Mr. Nixon was understood to have called for concessions on issues of human contact to achieve agreement for a meeting at the heads-of-government level concluding the European security conference.

docs.snippet: Argentines in vast numbers crowded the streets here today for an emotional farewell to President Juan Domingo Per6n, who had a dominant role in the nation's affairs for three decades. People on a street in Buenos Aires grieving yesterday as the...
docs.lead_paragraph: Argentines in vast numbers crowded the streets here today for an emotional farewell to President Juan Domingo Per6n, who had a dominant role in the nation's affairs for three decades. People on a street in Buenos Aires grieving yesterday as the coffin of President Juan Domingo Peron was carried pest on the way to the National Congress building. There, thousands moved by the bier.

headline.main: Emotional Throng Mourns Peron as Rites Are Held; Long Lines of Mourners Coffin Covered With Flag
